isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE OPERATION - Continuous Monitor

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Continuous Monitor is (a series of continuous diagnostic tests) done by the Electronic Control Module (ECM) to detect failure modes (Out of Range, In Range, and System Faults). During Continuous Monitor the ignition key is on.

item.para: Out of Range High (Voltage over normal operating range)
Out of Range Low (Voltage under normal operating range)
In Range (In normal operating range but not correct for conditions)
System Malfunction (System is not operating according to conditions)

svcproc.para: If an input signal is out of range, over or under normal operating range, the ECM records and sets a Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC). The ECM monitors the operation of systems for in range conditions to determine if systems are working in a normal operational range; If the ECM detects that a system falls outside a predetermined range, it will record a fault and set a DTC.
Each DTC has a three digit number to identify the source of a malfunction measured or monitored electronically.

The ECM continuously monitors the Injection Control Pressure (ICP) system and the Air Management System (AMS) . If the ECM detects that a system falls outside a predetermined range, the ECM records a fault and sets a DTC.
A fault is a malfunction measured or monitored electronically. Faults are recorded as DTCs.

During normal engine operation, the ECM automatically performs several tests to detect faults. When a fault is detected, the ECM often runs a fault management strategy to allow continued, though sometimes degraded, vehicle operation.
